p: Shah et al. [ 156] had investigated the aromatic profile and organoleptic qualities of kinnow exposed to an AgNPs coating consisting of CMC and guar gum. The sensory qualities of both coated and uncoated fruit stored at 10 °C declined during the storage period. Significant losses of linalool, limonene, and γ-terpinene content were prevented by the application of gum-Ag coatings and storage at 4 °C. Kinnow coated with the coating kept the sensory quality and fruit aroma for 120 d at a storage temperature of 4 °C.
